headline: Public Firms Turn to Capital Markets to Accelerate Bitcoin Accumulation
summary: Two publicly listed firms have recently taken significant steps to grow their Bitcoin treasuries, reflecting the continued adoption of cryptocurrency as a corporate reserve asset. Strategy Inc. (NASDAQ: MSTR) added approximately 10,000 BTC using proceeds from its latest preferred stock issuance, while BitMine Immersion Technologies (NYSE American: BMNR) finalized the purchase of over 150 BTC following a common stock offering. BitMine Immersion Technologies Completes $16.3M Bitcoin Treasury Acquisition Following Public Stock Offering BitMine Immersion Technologies, Inc. (NYSE American: BMNR), a publicly traded Bitcoin network infrastructure and investment company, has officially completed the deployment of all net proceeds from its recent equity raise into direct Bitcoin purchases, reinforcing its long-term strategy to build a Bitcoin-centric treasury model. In an announcement released Tuesday, the company revealed it had finalized the acquisition of 154.167 Bitcoin at an average price of $106,033 per coin, using $16.347 million‚Äîa sum that nearly mirrors the $16.340 million in net proceeds raised from its offering of common stock, which closed on June 6, 2025. A Bitcoin-First Corporate Treasury CEO Jonathan Bates commented on the milestone, saying, ‚ÄúWe are very excited to establish our Bitcoin Treasury and fulfill our commitment to invest 100% of the transaction proceeds into Bitcoin,‚Äù said Bates. ‚ÄúThis is not just a financial strategy‚Äîit‚Äôs a fundamental part of our identity as a Bitcoin-native business.‚Äù This direct investment marks one of the most aggressive treasury conversions to Bitcoin among US-listed public companies in 2025, aligning BitMine with the likes of Strategy and other Bitcoin-forward enterprises that have prioritized the digital asset over traditional fiat reserves. BitMine has differentiated itself from other crypto mining firms by blending traditional immersion cooling-based Bitcoin mining with emerging services in the synthetic hashrate and Bitcoin-denominated financial product sectors. The company operates mining sites in low-cost energy regions, including Trinidad, Pecos, Texas, and Silverton, where it can scale operations while minimizing energy expenditure‚Äîa critical component in maintaining profitability, especially in an increasingly competitive post-halving mining environment. Additionally, BitMine offers Bitcoin advisory services to public companies interested in navigating the complexities of earning and holding Bitcoin, either through direct mining or hashrate-related financial instruments. Market Context and Institutional Confidence The announcement comes at a time when institutional confidence in Bitcoin continues to rise, fueled by the success of spot Bitcoin ETFs, a growing list of corporate adopters , and renewed global interest in decentralized assets amid monetary policy uncertainty. Bitcoin is currently trading around $105,000, making BitMine‚Äôs average entry price relatively close to market. BitMine‚Äôs Bitcoin allocation strategy mirrors the broader corporate shift toward hard assets amid inflationary concerns and currency debasement. It also reflects the company's intent to treat Bitcoin not merely as a speculative asset, but as a strategic treasury reserve and operational foundation. As with all crypto-facing companies, BitMine has acknowledged the risks in its forward-looking statements. These include the volatility of Bitcoin, regulatory developments, and the company‚Äôs ability to adapt to a fast-evolving technology and financial landscape. Investors are reminded that future performance could vary based on a wide array of factors, including competition, energy pricing, the global economic climate, and the evolving valuation of Bitcoin itself. The company filed its latest Form 10-K with the SEC on April 3, 2025, and notes that all forward-looking statements are subject to the risks and disclosures outlined in those filings. Strategy Inc. Nears 600,000 Bitcoin as It Converts $1B in Preferred Stock Sales into Massive BTC Purchase In related news, corporate Bitcoin treasury firm Strategy Inc. (NASDAQ: MSTR) has acquired approximately 10,000 additional bitcoins for $1 billion, bringing its total holdings to a staggering 592,100 BTC‚Äîjust shy of the 600,000 BTC milestone. This monumental purchase cements Strategy‚Äôs dominance as the largest publicly traded holder of Bitcoin and underscores its long-term conviction in the digital asset as a superior treasury reserve. The company‚Äôs relentless Bitcoin accumulation has drawn widespread attention from both institutional investors and regulatory observers alike. Top 10 largest corporate Bitcoin holders (Source: BitcoinTreasuries ) The latest acquisition was primarily funded by the $1 billion upsized IPO of the firm‚Äôs newly launched Stride (STRD) perpetual preferred stock, which offers a 10% non-cumulative fixed dividend and is non-convertible. The offering drew strong institutional interest and marks another key pillar in the company‚Äôs innovative financing ecosystem. Additional funding for the purchase was sourced from the at-the-market (ATM) sales of two other perpetual preferred stock programs: Strike (STRK) and Strife (STRF). STRK offers an 8% fixed dividend and is convertible, while STRF provides a 10% cumulative dividend and is non-convertible. According to TD Cowen analysts, this structured approach ‚Äúestablishes a channel for future high-yield funds flows into Bitcoin,‚Äù providing Strategy with scalable, long-term funding sources that minimize dilution to common shareholders while maximizing Bitcoin exposure. The Bigger Vision: ‚Äú42/42‚Äù and Long-Term Leverage The latest round of buying is part of Strategy‚Äôs aggressive and ambitious ‚Äú42/42‚Äù plan, which seeks to raise $84 billion in equity and convertible debt offerings by 2027, all earmarked for Bitcoin acquisitions. The firm, led by Bitcoin evangelist and Executive Chairman Michael Saylor, has become synonymous with the institutionalization of Bitcoin. On a recent earnings call, Saylor outlined the firm‚Äôs target leverage ratio of 20%‚Äì30%, calculated as total debt and preferred stock divided by the market value of Strategy‚Äôs Bitcoin holdings. As of now, the firm sits on $63 billion in Bitcoin and $11.6 billion in total liabilities (including preferred shares), which analysts say supports a strong balance sheet. Analysts at TD Cowen remain bullish, reaffirming their ‚ÄúBuy‚Äù rating on Strategy stock and setting a $590 price target for MSTR shares. In a note published Tuesday, the bank emphasized the relative safety of Strategy‚Äôs junior securities given the firm‚Äôs asset base and modest debt load. The perpetual nature of the preferred stock means the capital raised can remain on the balance sheet indefinitely, offering the firm consistent liquidity without the looming burden of debt maturity‚Äîmaking it a highly flexible instrument for Bitcoin acquisition. Strategy‚Äôs Role in Institutionalizing Bitcoin Strategy Inc.'s actions are seen as a watershed moment for Bitcoin‚Äôs integration into traditional corporate finance. By issuing fixed-income-style securities tied to a Bitcoin accumulation strategy, the firm is effectively creating a new model for capital markets to interface with crypto assets. This model allows yield-hungry investors to access Bitcoin exposure through income-generating instruments, while enabling Strategy to accumulate BTC without shareholder dilution. It also sends a strong message to Wall Street: Bitcoin is not just a hedge or an asset‚Äîit's a treasury standard. With this latest purchase, Strategy now holds more Bitcoin than most countries and is rapidly approaching the symbolic 600,000 BTC mark. As the price of Bitcoin continues to climb, the company‚Äôs holdings represent a significant portion of the total circulating supply, amplifying its influence in the crypto and financial sectors.

headline: Internet Computer (ICP) integrates Solana to create multi-chain apps
summary: The Internet Computer Protocol (ICP) will integrate Solana in an attempt to create multi-chain apps. ICP has already integrated Bitcoin and Ethereum, and is capable of hosting DeFi projects at a lower cost, while tapping the liquidity in those networks. Dfinity Foundation, the creator and major contributor to the Internet Computer Protocol (ICP) announced the integration of Solana onto the ICP chain. The new integration uses ICP‚Äôs Fusion technology, allowing the protocol to connect to some of the world‚Äôs most active public blockchains. ‚ÄúBy bridging the gap between Solana and ICP through Chain Fusion, we are granting developers with powerful new tools to build next-generation dApps that unify speed, security, and decentralization in one seamless experience, essentially dissolving the barriers that limit blockchain innovation,‚Äù said Jan Camenisch, Chief Technology Officer at Dfinity. The integration of Solana means that the native smart contracts of ICP, known as canisters, can interact with the other chain and fuse DeFi with seamless performance and security. The technology removes the need for a bridge, which is one of the riskiest and most attacked types of smart contracts. Canisters are a form of smart wallets, which allow the reading of addresses and the distribution of funds based on predetermined permission settings. The Chain Fusion technology will enable app builders to launch on ICP without a need for a full migration. This will allow the growing user base of ICP to tap external DeFi liquidity, with higher speed and at a lower cost. Solana apps can also use the efficient on-chain processing of ICP, instead of adding another off-chain component. Dfinity aims for decentralized Internet ecosystem The integration of multiple public chains marks another step for Dfinity toward building a decentralized Internet ecosystem. The fusion of chains will open up additional Web3 opportunities for both projects and end users. The fusion will open up ICP to a potential 4.8M daily active users, after the recent growth of Solana due to meme token and DEX activity. ICP also has a limited DeFi sector, with just under $30M in total value locked, but the chain is suitable to host already established apps in DEX trading and lending. The chain also carries around 297 BTC in wrapped form, also used for DeFi security. Currently, ICP carries around 9K in daily internet identities or active users, based on Token Terminal data . The chain has around 5.3K daily unique active wallets. For now, it remains uncertain which apps will use both chains for their activity. ICP currently trades at around $5.12, within its middle range for the past month. The chain is currently ranked in 190th place based on its activity and apps , while hosting a handful of native projects with their own tokens. Despite its relatively low rank, ICP is one of the growing chains in 2025, aiming to revive its activity during the current bull market and increased demand for Web3 activity. ICP has raised $167M in multiple high-profile ranks, backed by a16z and Polychain Capital. The chain has been through several market cycles since its inception in 2018, and aims to tap the currently hot chains for DEX and lending activity. headline: Bitcoin‚Äôs Explosive Potential: LTH Selling Signals Major Bull Run
summary: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin‚Äôs Explosive Potential: LTH Selling Signals Major Bull Run Are we on the cusp of another significant move for Bitcoin ? Recent observations from prominent crypto analysts suggest that key market participants, specifically Long-Term Holders (LTHs), are exhibiting behavior historically associated with periods preceding substantial price increases. This fascinating insight, derived from on-chain data, offers a compelling look into the underlying conviction of those who have held onto their Bitcoin through thick and thin. What Are Bitcoin Long-Term Holders (LTHs) and Why Do They Matter? In the world of Bitcoin , holders are often categorized based on how long they‚Äôve kept their coins. Short-Term Holders (STHs) typically hold Bitcoin for less than 155 days, often being newer market entrants or traders. Long-Term Holders (LTHs), on the other hand, are wallets that have held their Bitcoin for 155 days or longer. This distinction is crucial because LTHs represent the ‚Äòstrong hands‚Äô in the market ‚Äì those with high conviction who are less likely to sell during minor dips or volatility. Their selling or accumulation patterns can provide significant clues about the overall market sentiment and potential supply dynamics. When LTHs sell, it can indicate profit-taking or capitulation. When they stop selling or even accumulate, it often signals confidence in future price appreciation and can lead to a supply squeeze on exchanges, potentially driving prices up. Understanding the behavior of this cohort is a cornerstone of effective crypto analysis . Decoding the Bullish Signal : LTH Selling Reaches Historic Lows According to crypto analyst Axel Adler Jr., the current selling activity from Bitcoin Long-Term Holders is approaching levels rarely seen before. This means that despite market fluctuations, the most experienced and conviction-driven holders are choosing not to liquidate their positions. This lack of selling pressure from a group that holds a significant portion of the circulating supply is inherently bullish. Think of it this way: if the people who bought Bitcoin months or years ago, potentially at much lower prices, are holding onto their coins instead of cashing out, it suggests they believe the price is headed significantly higher. This collective decision by LTHs reduces the available supply on the market, especially on exchanges, making it easier for new demand to push the Bitcoin price upward. Past Performance: How Bitcoin Price Reacted to Similar LTH Behavior One of the most compelling aspects of this observation is its historical context. The analyst points out that there have been only four previous instances where LTH selling reached such low levels. The results following three of these four instances were remarkably consistent and positive for the Bitcoin price . Instance 1: LTH selling hits low. Instance 2: LTH selling hits low. Supporting Evidence: Other Bullish Signals from On-Chain Crypto Analysis The positive outlook isn‚Äôt solely reliant on LTH behavior. The analyst‚Äôs update also highlighted other key on-chain metrics that are flashing green. Two notable examples are Coin Days Destroyed (CDD) and Market Value to Realized Value (MVRV). Coin Days Destroyed (CDD): This metric gives more weight to coins that haven‚Äôt moved for a long time. A low CDD value indicates that older Bitcoin (held by LTHs) is not being spent or moved. Currently, low CDD values reinforce the observation that LTHs are holding, reducing selling pressure and indicating conviction rather than distribution. Market Value to Realized Value (MVRV): This ratio compares the current market price (Market Value) to the average purchase price of all coins (Realized Value). It helps identify periods where Bitcoin might be overvalued or undervalued relative to the cost basis of its holders. An MVRV ratio typically below 1 suggests undervaluation (though we are likely above 1 now, the *trend* and specific levels within a cycle are key). Bullish signals often emerge when MVRV is recovering from lower levels or consolidating at levels historically seen before price rallies, indicating that the market as a whole is not yet excessively profitable, thus reducing the incentive for widespread selling. The confluence of these metrics ‚Äì low LTH selling, low CDD, and favorable MVRV trends ‚Äì paints a cohesive picture of a market structure that appears primed for potential upward movement, according to this crypto analysis perspective. Beyond the Data: Current Bitcoin Market Trends While on-chain data provides invaluable insights into holder behavior, it‚Äôs also important to consider the broader market context. Regulatory uncertainty in various jurisdictions, potential for unexpected macroeconomic shocks, and the inherent volatility of the crypto market are factors that investors must always keep in mind. A comprehensive approach to understanding the potential trajectory of the Bitcoin price requires looking at both the micro (on-chain) and macro factors. Potential Challenges and Considerations for Your Bitcoin Investment While the signals discussed are undeniably bullish, it‚Äôs crucial to approach them with a balanced perspective. headline: Bitcoin 'Accumulator' Better Fit for Corporates Than Dollar-Cost Averaging Strategy, Research Suggests
summary: Corporate adoption of bitcoin BTC is well-known, and most of it involves a classic buy-and-hold strategy, loosely analogous to the dollar-cost averaging (DCA) strategy. While investors of all kinds widely prefer DCA, new research by crypto options market maker OrBit Markets shows that since 2023, it has underperformed a structured product called an "accumulator," popularly known as "I Kill You Later" in traditional markets. "Our backtest results show that the accumulator strategy outperformed DCA over the past 2.5-year period," said Pulkit Goyal, head of trading at OrBit Markets, told CoinDesk. "Three-month accumulators delivered a 10% outperformance, while longer tenors did even better ‚Äî six- and twelve-month accumulators outperformed by 13% and 26%, respectively." Goyal added that accumulators offer a disciplined, cost-effective approach to token accumulation, making them "a natural fit for crypto treasury companies' use case." Both DCA and the accumulator operate the same principle ‚Äì stop timing the market. While DCA simplifies investing by spreading out purchases over time, the accumulator helps acquire coins at a discount in a structured setup and helps outperform DCA during bull runs. Primer on accumulator The accumulator is a time-structured product linked to the performance of an underlying asset with an upside knock-out barrier ‚Äì level, which, if hit, terminates the structure. Here is how it works: An investor agrees to buy a certain amount of the underlying asset at a fixed, discounted price (the Strike) over regular intervals, such as daily or weekly, for a set period. The product runs through the pre-determined set period unless terminated early due to an early knock-out by the spot price rising to the barrier. Note that the investor has an obligation, not a choice, to buy the asset at the discounted strike price and must double the buy in case the spot price dips below the discounted strike. Example of BTC accumulator Consider a three-month accumulator where an investor commits to buy $1,000 worth of BTC every week at a strike price of $94,500, with a knock-out level of $115,000. The strike price of $94,500 is 90% of the current spot price of around $105,000. In other words, the investor is now mandated to snap up coins at a discount, assuming the spot price holds above the strike price of $94,500 and below the knock-out of $115,000. If BTC tops the knock-out level, the structure is terminated. If the price falls below $94,500, the investor doubles the weekly purchase to $ 4,000 at the same strike, i.e., $94,500 ‚Äì there is no way out, meaning the investor ends up buying at a price higher than the prevailing market rate. (this is why it gets the nickname "I kill you later.") Hence, the accumulator is not suitable for day traders, short-term traders and speculators and may not necessarily outperform DCA in a bear market. Backtesting OrBit backtested a three-month BTC accumulator, spanning from January 2023 to June 13, 2025, assuming the investor continuously rolled into a new one upon reaching maturity or a premature knock-out event. Results show an average BTC acquisition cost of $39,035 for the accumulator, which is 10% lower than the DCA average purchase price of $43,329. The DCA involved investing a fixed dollar amount in BTC every week. Longer maturity accumulators of 6 and 12 months performed even better, achieving average costs of $37,654 and $32,079, respectively,¬†outperforming DCA by 13% and 26%.
